intro: Scyphogyne inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous scyphogyne, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are usually white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
